content.description: A widely accepted hypothesis about the origin of life on Earth is that life arose approximately 3.5 billion years ago as the result of a complex sequence of chemical reactions that took place spontaneously in Earthâ€™s atmosphere. Another hypothesis about the origin of life suggests that life began somewhere else in the universe and arrived on Earth by chance.
content.question: Which of the following questions might scientists ask to most reliably determine if there has ever been life on Mars?

choices.label: How far from Earth was Mars 3.5 billion years ago?
Is there scientific proof that Earth ever had an oxygen-free atmosphere?
Did Mars have the elements present in its atmosphere to support life?
Was there oxygen gas on Mars 3.5 billion years ago?

content.answer: Did Mars have the elements present in its atmosphere to support life?

skill.text: 3.A: Identify or pose a testable question based on an observation, data, or a model.
